definition: to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]

sentences.english: He inserted a comment in the margin.
Some people annotate as they read.
sentences.chinese: 有些人边读书边作评注。

sentences.english: Dahlgren's system of classification of the angiosperms.
sentences.chinese: 被子植物分类系统介绍和评注。

sentences.english: It's also very easy to annotate pages and send your mark ups to other users.
sentences.chinese: 给网页加评注并把勾画发送给其他用户也很容易。

sentences.english: Discuss various grammatical forms that disjuncts may take.
sentences.chinese: 论述评注性状语可能采用的语法形式。

sentences.english: We don't care if it's true or not in an exegesis class.
sentences.chinese: 在评注课上我们不在乎真伪。

sentences.english: Some people annotate as they read .
sentences.chinese: 有些人边读书边作评注。

sentences.english: A spokesman for Bank of America declined to comment early Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 星期二早上一个美洲银行的发言人婉谢给予评注。

sentences.english: Finally this paper gives some numerical examples and makes a few remarks .
sentences.chinese: 最后给出了数值实例和评注。

sentences.english: There were so many books that he'd written in, and she was reading them all out of order.
sentences.chinese: 他在那么多书上作了评注，她只好不按顺序地翻着看。

definition: to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
headnotes/comments or footnotes at top of the page
author's preface/autobiographical notes as introduction to a book
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
